title:Pandapaxxy's Revenant Vendor Weapons
description:Based on https://www.reddit.com/r/sharditkeepit/comments/1gxhtco/revenant_vendor_weapons/

// Bygones
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Bygones is back and I'm sure a lot of Veteran players are happy. Bygones was one of those feel good weapons from Forsaken that never really got a proper replacement. Updated with more perks and an origin trait it can definitely find a solid place within your loadouts. Firefly is an interesting choice and allows for the best AoE. Pair that with Subsistence and you never have to reload. Kinetic Tremors is the best for single target damage with decent AoE and pairs best with Keep Away or Outlaw as you won't be killing as reliably if you proc Kinetic Tremors. Desperado will feel great if you can get it going and the obvious pairing is Outlaw for a faster proc." Recommended MW: Reload Speed.|tags:pve,mkb,controller
dimwishlist:item=2199554524&perks=839105230,1087426260,1820235745,3891536761

// Bygones
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): "With the recent adjustment to High Ground (and in my humble opinion, it might get adjusted again) Bygones still two bursts with a clean 6 crit. I feel it's still a little overturned for such an easy payoff. If you're looking to get that roll you know what to look for. But outside of that roll you've got great neutral perks like Eye of the Storm, Headseeker, Zen Moment, and Keep Away. Kill Clip will always *just work* and doesn't need too much thought to keep going. Bygones still remains a top choice but it's a tad less forgiving now." Recommended MW: Stability.|tags:pvp,controller

// Bygones
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): "With the recent adjustment to High Ground (and in my humble opinion, it might get adjusted again) Bygones still two bursts with a clean 6 crit. I feel it's still a little overturned for such an easy payoff. If you're looking to get that roll you know what to look for. But outside of that roll you've got great neutral perks like Eye of the Storm, Headseeker, Zen Moment, and Keep Away. Kill Clip will always *just work* and doesn't need too much thought to keep going. Bygones still remains a top choice but it's a tad less forgiving now." Recommended MW: Range.|tags:pvp,mkb

// Deadlock
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Deadlock is an interesting shotgun from a PvE perspective. It's got juiced stats, but most players don't need incredible stats, just great perks. Especially when perks like Grave Robber bypass the reload stat entirely. Threat Detector also boosts stats further so you can entirely have 100 stat points across multiple stats in PvE. Trench Barrel and One-Two Punch are both incredible for dealing burst damage and Cascade Point is just funny for a Fourth Horseman-lite experience." Recommended MW: Reload Speed.|tags:pve,mkb,controller
dimwishlist:item=2035738085&perks=1300023272,791862061,1631667848,2679249093

// Deadlock
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "Where all those stats can be put to better use is in the crucible. Deadlock, to no one's surprise, is best for the crucible. Perks like Lone Wolf, Closing Time, Slideshot, Threat Detector, and even Slickdraw are all great for this shotgun. Slickdraw less so because of the handling you can get from the stock options. This might just be the best shotgun in the game and I'm glad it competes for the same slot as Rose otherwise we'd have the Sparebender's meta all over again with the same two weapons dominating the crucible." Recommended MW: Range or Handling.|tags:pvp,mkb,controller

// Fair Judgment
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Our newest Ritual Weapon is Fair Judgement. A stasis auto rifle that has pretty low to medium tier stats across the board. Its uniqueness comes from being only the second precision frame stasis auto rifle. The other being last year's Horror Story that was dropped from the recently concluded Festival of the Lost. Rimestealer and Headstone are both fantastic together for stasis synergy and even outside of stasis to build up Frost Armor stacks." Recommended MW: Handling.|tags:pve,mkb,controller
dimwishlist:item=4176873718&perks=4090651448,1968497646,1955165503,95528736
dimwishlist:item=4176873718&perks=4090651448,1968497646,1955165503,124408337
dimwishlist:item=4176873718&perks=4090651448,1968497646,1359896290,95528736
dimwishlist:item=4176873718&perks=4090651448,1968497646,1359896290,124408337

// Fair Judgment
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "Fair Judgement will not shatter any expectations within the crucible. Precision frame auto rifles are just not as good as other options. Onslaught will drop the TtK with each stack and Dynamic Sway Reduction will help out in keeping the bullets going where you want them to. Outside of this it's good for ornaments and checking off another box for collections (oh and free shards)." Recommended MW: Handling.|tags:pvp,mkb,controller
dimwishlist:item=4176873718&perks=4090651448,1968497646,1359896290,95528736
dimwishlist:item=4176873718&perks=4090651448,1968497646,1359896290,124408337

dimwishlist:item=4176873718&perks=4090651448,1968497646,1955165503,124408337

// Anonymous Autumn

It doesn't deal as much going into higher end PvE activities but TV doesn't care. He'll still make a build and use this in some wacky off-meta way." Recommended MW: Reload Speed.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Anonymous Autumn
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): "Where Anonymous Autumn and TrueVanguard both find their homes is in the crucible. Range is going to be key as sidearms get shredded in distance by autos and SMGs. Pushing out your effective range can help someone backpedaling or just when you're above them. Lone Wolf, Zen Moment, and Rangefinder all improve the feel of this weapon in different ways, coupled with Kill Clip for explosive damage in your second engagement, Precision Instrument to shave off some crits required or even drop the TtK on lower resiliences would be good if you can reliably hit crits. Harmony really shines when swapping between weapons." Recommended MW: Range.|tags:pvp,controller

// Anonymous Autumn
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): "Where Anonymous Autumn and TrueVanguard both find their homes is in the crucible. Range is going to be key as sidearms get shredded in distance by autos and SMGs. Pushing out your effective range can help someone backpedaling or just when you're above them. Lone Wolf, Zen Moment, and Rangefinder all improve the feel of this weapon in different ways, coupled with Kill Clip for explosive damage in your second engagement, Precision Instrument to shave off some crits required or even drop the TtK on lower resiliences would be good if you can reliably hit crits. Harmony really shines when swapping between weapons." Recommended MW: Range.|tags:pvp,mkb

// Wicked Sister
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Wicked Sister was not a weapon I thought would be reintroduced. It fell way under the radar back in Year 1 but now is back and immediately outclasses many other grenade launchers. Clown Cartridgento Envious Arsenal, Field Prep or Auto-Loading Holster; you've got your choice in the third column. Pair that with again your choice of Explosive Light, Bait and Switch or Cascade Point and you've got a solid workhorse for most any activity." Recommended MW: Blast Radius.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Wicked Sister
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "With the health changes you're going to want to push for greater than 70 Blast radius. Wicked Sister can hit that and get Impulse Amplifier for boosted velocity. I prefer Explosive Light in the last column to really push up the damage on non-direct hits but Chain Reaction is also great if your aim is better than mine." Recommended MW: Blast Radius.|tags:pvp,mkb,controller
